title: import-existing-data
text: Whenever module server instance launched without data model (.e data.model argument NULL persistent data model found instance id), “Import data” button displayed along “Create” button Data model section Administration console (output admin_UI() function). step step modal dialog opened perform import.

title: import-existing-data
text: first step select source file containing data imported. browser window display .csv files. Select file click open. ‘Upload complete’ message displayed fileInput, click “Next” button (Cancel).

title: import-existing-data
text: data table (DT) displayed preview data. Click “Next” (Cancel want abort).

title: import-existing-data
text: data model build data (using dm_integrity() function). Template classes applied ‘known’ attribute names (like date id). part template, attribute type guessed using class() function. Click “Import” confirm data import (Cancel abort)

title: import-existing-data
text: Data imported location provided path attribute module server function. data model created saved.

title: Authors and Citation
text: philippe peret. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: peret p (2024). kitems: Framework Manage Data.frame Items. R package version 0.5.6, https://thekangaroofactory.github.io/kitems/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {kitems: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items},   author = {philippe peret},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.5.6},   url = {https://thekangaroofactory.github.io/kitems/}, }

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: goal kitems provide framework manage data.frame like items set tools implement within shiny web application. reason, delivered shiny module.

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: can install development version kitems GitHub :

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: basic shiny demo app shows use package delivered can run:

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: kitems framework based two main notions: data model items.

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: data model contains specifications items want manage. includes: name type default value default function filter skip Supported types : numeric integer logical character factor Date POSIXct Note: class POSIXlt supported stores datetime values list recommended store data.frame. Defaults (value function) used setup value ’s provided item creation process. function, reference function passed (callback), example “Sys.Date” Filter logical indicate attribute filtered item views (example id) Skip logical indicate attribute skipped build input form (thus get default value)

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: Items data.frame containing data managed.

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: kitems strongly relies Shiny (shiny shinydashboard packages set ‘depends’ dependencies). provides reactive values (accessible module server return value): data_model (reactiveVal) items (reactiveVal) filtered_items (reactiveVal) selected_items (reactiveVal) clicked_column (reactiveVal) filter_date (reactiveVal) module server return value following structure: [!CAUTION] Data model items reactive values handled caution updating values trigger auto save (items, autosave = TRUE).
code: list(id,      url,      items,      data_model,      filtered_items,      selected_items,      clicked_column,      filter_date)

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: data model can accessed reactive context return value list, data_model()
code: library(kitems)  # -- call module mydata <- kitems_server(id = "my_data_id", path = "path/to/my/data", create = TRUE, autosave = TRUE)  # -- get data model data_model <- mydata$data_model()

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: items id can accessed reactive context return value list, items()
code: # -- call module mydata <- kitems_server(id = "my_data_id", path = "path/to/my/data", create = TRUE, autosave = TRUE)  # -- get items items <- mydata$items()

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: starting module id path arguments, check corresponding data model available (file exists). data model found, admin UI display create button start new data model, well import data button.

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: module server launched, perform integrity check ensure data (items) data model aligned. done dm_integrity() function. aligned, data model updated match missing attribute example.

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: ’s recommended use item_create() function create item added item list: Note: autosave turned , item_save function used make item changes persistent.
code: library(kitems)  # -- call module mydata <- kitems_server(id = "my_data_id", path = "path/to/my/data", create = TRUE, autosave = TRUE)  # -- define inputs and create item (waning! this should be used in a reactive context) input_values <- data.frame(id = 1, text = "demo") item <- item_create(values = input_values, data.model = mydata$data_model())  # -- add item (waning! this should be used in a reactive context) item_add(items = mydata$items, item)

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: ’s recommended use item_create() function create new item replace one item list:
code: library(kitems)  # -- call module mydata <- kitems_server(id = "my_data_id", path = "path/to/my/data", create = TRUE, autosave = TRUE)  # -- define inputs and create item (waning! this should be used in a reactive context) input_values <- data.frame(id = 1, text = "demo") item <- item_create(values = input_values, data.model = mydata$data_model())  # -- update item (waning! this should be used in a reactive context) item_update(items = mydata$items, item)

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: delete item, just pass ’s id trigger:
code: library(kitems)  # -- call module mydata <- kitems_server(id = "my_data_id", path = "path/to/my/data", create = TRUE, autosave = TRUE)  # -- delete item (waning! this should be used in a reactive context) item_id <- 1704961867683  item_delete(mydata$items, id)

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: default view provided items_view_DT(). based items content (data model masks applied).

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: filtered view provided filtered_view_ui() based filtered_items content (data model masks applied).

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: default filtered view row selection enabled. Selecting row(s) one table trigger update selected_items reactive value. [!CAUTION] recommended display views UI section last selection kept selected_items Selected item(s) also trigger buttons available (NULL).

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: data model attribute named ‘date’, date sliderInput created automatically enable date filtering. sliderInput trigger filter items displayed filtered view, .e. matching items part view. implemented date_slider_INPUT() application’s UI, date filter applied default filtered view. Filter value (sliderInput range) available filter_date reactive value. Note case want build reactive object top filter_date filtered_items, recommended test NULL avoid firing computation startup.

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: create_BTN: create item update_BTN: update selected item (single selection) delete_BTN: delete selected item(s) (supports multi-selection) update_BTN delete_BTN return NULL row selected.

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: order avoid code duplication, admin UI interface provided admin_ui() function.
code: # -- Inside tabItems tabItems(...,           tabItem(tabName = "mydata",                                    # -- Admin UI                  fluidRow(                    column(width = 12,                                                      kitems::admin_ui("mydata")))) )

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: sidebarMenu object (menuItem) also available output dynamic_sidebar() function. contain one menuSubItem object per data model (stored r reactive values). implement sidebar UI, must first rendered application server code: can use output inside application UI code: tabName linked menuSubItem named module id. example access administration console menuSubItem:
code: # ------------------------------------- # Generate dynamic sidebar # -------------------------------------  output$menu <- renderMenu(dynamic_sidebar(names = list("data", "data2"))) # ------------------------------------- # Define Sidebar UI # -------------------------------------  sidebar <- dashboardSidebar(    # -- static section   sidebarMenu(     menuItem("Home", tabName = "home", icon = icon("dashboard"), selected = TRUE)),    # -- add dynamic section   sidebarMenu(id = "tabs", sidebarMenuOutput("menu")),    collapsed = FALSE) # -- kitems admin tabItem(tabName = "my_data",                  # -- Admin UI         fluidRow(           column(width = 12,                                    kitems::admin_ui("my_data"))))

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: case kitems_server module server function called inside module (.e. nested module), possible call UI functions main app nested module id. , two options available: wrap package UI functions functions calling module (encapsulation) example, create action_BTN function implement create_BTN, update_BTN delete_BTN single UI call package UI functions directly main app using multiple namespaces: (specified shiny::NS function)

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
text: module server initialized data.model = NULL, import data button displayed data model section admin UI. allows create data model existing data.

title: Framework To Manage Data.frame Items
code: # ------------------------------------- # Observe item lists # -------------------------------------  id <- "mydata" mydata <- items_name(id)  # -- Module id = mydata observeEvent(mydata$items(), {      cat("Main application server observer: items object has just been updated. \n")    })

what: Add attribute to a data model — attribute_create
title: Add attribute to a data model — attribute_create
text: Add attribute data model

title: Add attribute to a data model — attribute_create
code: attribute_create(   data.model,   name,   type,   default.val = NULL,   default.fun = NULL,   default.arg = NULL,   filter = NULL,   skip = NULL,   sort.rank = NULL,   sort.desc = NULL )

title: Add attribute to a data model — attribute_create
text: data.model mandatory data model, structured output data_model() function name mandatory character string new attribute name type mandatory character string new attribute type default.val optional named vector values, defining default values. default.fun optional named vector functions, defining default functions used generate default values. default.arg optional named vector arguments, pass along default function. filter optional character vector, name(s) attribute(s) filter skip optional character vector, name(s) attribute(s) skip sort.rank optional named numeric vector, define sort orders sort.desc optional named logical vector, define sort descending

title: Add attribute to a data model — attribute_create
text: updated data model

title: Add attribute to a data model — attribute_create
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ attribute_create(data.model = mydatamodel, name = "new_attribute", type = "character") attribute_create(data.model = mydatamodel, name = "total", type = "numeric", default.val = 0) attribute_create(data.model = mydatamodel, name = "date", type = "Date", default.fun = "Sys.Date") attribute_create(data.model = mydatamodel, name = "progress", type = "integer", skip = "progress") attribute_create(data.model = mydatamodel, name = "internal", type = "logical", filter = "internal") } # }

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ attribute_delete(k_data_model, k_items, name = "comment", MODULE = "mydata", autosave = TRUE, dm_url = dm_url, items_url = items_url, notify = TRUE) } # }

title: Build Attribute Shortcuts — attribute_shortcut
text: Build Attribute Shortcuts

title: Build Attribute Shortcuts — attribute_shortcut
text: colClass length-one named vector. names(colClass) name attribute, colClass type (class) attribute. suggestions list suggestions, output attribute_suggestion ns module namespace function reference

title: Build Attribute Shortcuts — attribute_shortcut
text: list actionLink objects return value output lapply applying actionLink suggestions actionLink onclick property trigger input$shortcut_trigger (ns(shortcut_trigger)) value form [ns]-[attribute]_[value] Basically, applying tail(unlist(strsplit(input$shortcut_trigger, split = "-")), 1) access attribute_value Note POSIXct attribute, shortcut_trigger input carry timezone information. Clicking corresponding actionLink trigger date & time inputs update.

title: Build Attribute Shortcuts — attribute_shortcut
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ attribute_shortcut(colClass = c(name = "character"), suggestions = list(mango = 25, banana = 12, lemon = 10), ns = session$ns) } # }

title: Attribute Suggestions — attribute_suggestion
text: Attribute Suggestions

title: Attribute Suggestions — attribute_suggestion
text: values vector values, probably vector corresponding one item data frame columns type optional character vector, type (class) values. provided, class(values) used n desired number suggestions. applies character, factor, numeric & integer types floor numeric value. applies numeric & integer types. none value frequency (%) reaches floor, basic suggestions returned (see details)

title: Attribute Suggestions — attribute_suggestion
text: list suggestions list depends type values character, factor: frequent values ; list(value1 = frequency, value_2, = frequency) numeric, integer: frequent values ; list(value1 = frequency, value_2, = frequency), standard list ; list(min, max, mean, median) logical: frequency values ; list(true = frequency, false = frequency) Date, POSIXct: standard list ; list(min, max)

title: Attribute Suggestions — attribute_suggestion
text: numeric & integer values, default strategy compute n frequent occurrences. occurrence reaches floor level (% items), standard list returned.

title: Attribute Suggestions — attribute_suggestion
code: foo <- c(rep("banana", 5), rep("mango", 3), rep("orange", 2)) attribute_suggestion(values = foo, type = "character") #> $banana #> [1] 50 #>  #> $mango #> [1] 30 #>  #> $orange #> [1] 20 #>

title: Update data model attribute — attribute_update
text: data.model data.frame containing data model name character string attribute name default.val character string, new default value default.fun character string, new default function name default.arg optional named vector arguments, pass along default function. skip logical set skip value filter logical set filter value sort.rank numeric, used define sort rank sort.desc logical, define sorting descending order

title: Update data model attribute — attribute_update
text: updated data model

title: Update data model attribute — attribute_update
text: Updating attribute class supported function (requires data migration). Use vector update several attributes supported long length different parameters either name 1 (rows gets value).

title: Update data model attribute — attribute_update
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ #Use of vector to update several attributes: attribute_update(data.model = dm,                  name = c("name","total"),                  default.val = c("test", 2),                  default.fun = NULL,                  default.arg = NULL,                  skip = TRUE) } # }

title: Build data model — data_model
text: Build data model

title: Build data model — data_model
code: data_model(   colClasses,   default.val = NULL,   default.fun = NULL,   default.arg = NULL,   filter = NULL,   skip = NULL,   sort.rank = NULL,   sort.desc = NULL )

title: Build data model — data_model
text: colClasses mandatory named vector classes, defining data model. default.val optional named vector values, defining default values. default.fun optional named vector functions, defining default functions used generate default values. default.arg optional named vector arguments, pass along default function. filter optional character vector, indicating attribute names filtered table view. skip optional character vector, indicating attribute names skipped user input form. sort.rank optional named numeric vector, define sort orders. sort.desc optional named logical vector, define sort descending.

title: Build data model — data_model
text: data.frame containing data model.

title: Build data model — data_model
text: colClasses used create data.frame: names define attributes data model, values define class (type) attributes. default.* parameters optional. provided, used match names defined colClasses: order vectors matter need set values attributes (see examples) names vectors matching colClasses names ignored default.fun default.val mutual exclusive, priority default.fun (default.val forced NA) default.arg requires default.fun NULL (forced NA otherwise) filter skip directly contains names attributes set TRUE provided, defaults applied: NA default.val, default.fun default.arg FALSE filter skip

title: Build data model — data_model
code: # -- order in vectors doesn't matter: default.val <- c("name" = "test", "total" = 2) default.val <- c("total" = 2, "name" = "test")  # -- no need to set all values colClasses <- c("id" = "numeric", "name" = "character", "total" = "numeric") default.val <- c("name" = "test", "total" = 2)  # -- filter and skip filter <- "id" skip <- c("id", "date")  # -- sort sort.rank = c("date" = 1, "total" = 2, "name" = 3) sort.desc = c("date" = TRUE, "total" = FALSE)  data_model(colClasses, default.val, filter = filter, skip = skip) #>    name      type default.val default.fun default.arg filter  skip sort.rank #> 1    id   numeric        <NA>          NA          NA   TRUE  TRUE        NA #> 2  name character        test          NA          NA  FALSE FALSE        NA #> 3 total   numeric           2          NA          NA  FALSE FALSE        NA #>   sort.desc #> 1        NA #> 2        NA #> 3        NA

title: Search Items — item_search
text: simple wrapper around filter function

text: items data.frame items pattern search pattern

title: Search Items — item_search
text: filtered data.frame

title: Search Items — item_search
text: function intended perform smart advanced search.  provides basic search across except id attributes. Basically returns filter(items, if_any(-(id), ~ grepl(pattern, .)))

title: Search Items — item_search
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ item_search(items = mydata$items(), pattern = "Banana") item_search(items = mydata$items(), pattern = 25) } # }

code: kitems_server(   id,   path,   create = TRUE,   autosave = TRUE,   admin = FALSE,   shortcut = FALSE )

title: Module server — kitems_server
text: id id used module server instance path path data model items stored create logical whether data file created missing (default = TRUE) autosave logical whether item auto save activated (default = TRUE) admin logical indicating admin module server launched (default = FALSE) shortcut logical attribute shortcuts computed building item form (default = FALSE)

title: Module server — kitems_server
text: autosave FALSE, item_save function used make data persistent. make data model persistent, use saveRDS function. file name consistent output dm_name function used id plus .rds extension. admin FALSE, admin_ui return 'empty' layout (tabs content) dynamic_sidebar affected parameter. expected function used admin = FALSE.

title: Module server — kitems_server
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ kitems_server(id = "mydata", path = "path/to/my/data",               create = TRUE, autosave = TRUE) } # }
